result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Jacob Neveaux appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Cody Jacob Neveaux. 
Defense still waiting for an offer from the state, request add'l time.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Umpleby is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate to be decided
The first payment date will be decided at a later date.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.

3:40 PM Defendant Cody Jacob Neveaux by phone means, in custody.  Claudia T. Johnson appeared for the Wisconsin, State of by phone means. Court to apoint an attorney. Defendant is in agreement w/appointment of counsel. Court leaves preliminary hearing on the calendar for next week. Defendant filed a bond motion-court hears. Defendant requesting a signature bond to start treatment. State objects. Court denies bond motion at this time.
